net.majorkernelpanic.streaming

Interface Stream

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AACStream, AMRNBStream, AudioStream, H263Stream, H264Stream, MediaStream, VideoStream

    public interface Stream
    An interface that represents a Stream.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void configure()
      Configures the stream.
      long getBitrate()
      Returns an approximation of the bit rate consumed by the stream in bit per seconde.
      int[] getDestinationPorts()
      Returns a pair of destination ports, the first one is the one used for RTP and the second one is used for RTCP.
      int[] getLocalPorts()
      Returns a pair of source ports, the first one is the one used for RTP and the second one is used for RTCP.
      java.lang.String getSessionDescription()
      Returns a description of the stream using SDP.
      int getSSRC()
      Returns the SSRC of the underlying RtpSocket.
      boolean isStreaming() 
      void setDestinationAddress(java.net.InetAddress dest)
      Sets the destination ip address of the stream.
      void setDestinationPorts(int dport)
      Sets the destination ports of the stream.
      void setDestinationPorts(int rtpPort, int rtcpPort)
      Sets the destination ports of the stream.
      void setOutputStream(java.io.OutputStream stream, byte channelIdentifier)
      If a TCP is used as the transport protocol for the RTP session, the output stream to which RTP packets will be written to must be specified with this method.
      void setTimeToLive(int ttl)
      Sets the Time To Live of packets sent over the network.
      void start()
      Starts the stream.
      void stop()
      Stops the stream.

    • Method Detail

      • configure

        void configure()
               throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                      java.io.IOException
        Configures the stream. You need to call this before calling getSessionDescription() to apply your configuration of the stream.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException
        java.io.IOException

      • start

        void start()
           throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                  java.io.IOException
        Starts the stream. This method can only be called after configure().
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException
        java.io.IOException

      • stop

        void stop()
        Stops the stream.

      • setTimeToLive

        void setTimeToLive(int ttl)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Sets the Time To Live of packets sent over the network.
        Parameters:
        ttl - The time to live
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • setDestinationAddress

        void setDestinationAddress(java.net.InetAddress dest)
        Sets the destination ip address of the stream.
        Parameters:
        dest - The destination address of the stream

      • setDestinationPorts

        void setDestinationPorts(int dport)
        Sets the destination ports of the stream. If an odd number is supplied for the destination port then the next lower even number will be used for RTP and it will be used for RTCP. If an even number is supplied, it will be used for RTP and the next odd number will be used for RTCP.
        Parameters:
        dport - The destination port

      • setDestinationPorts

        void setDestinationPorts(int rtpPort,
                       int rtcpPort)
        Sets the destination ports of the stream.
        Parameters:
        rtpPort - Destination port that will be used for RTP
        rtcpPort - Destination port that will be used for RTCP

      • setOutputStream

        void setOutputStream(java.io.OutputStream stream,
                   byte channelIdentifier)
        If a TCP is used as the transport protocol for the RTP session, the output stream to which RTP packets will be written to must be specified with this method.

      • getLocalPorts

        int[] getLocalPorts()
        Returns a pair of source ports, the first one is the one used for RTP and the second one is used for RTCP.

      • getDestinationPorts

        int[] getDestinationPorts()
        Returns a pair of destination ports, the first one is the one used for RTP and the second one is used for RTCP.

      • getSSRC

        int getSSRC()
        Returns the SSRC of the underlying RtpSocket.
        Returns:
        the SSRC of the stream.

      • getBitrate

        long getBitrate()
        Returns an approximation of the bit rate consumed by the stream in bit per seconde.

      • getSessionDescription

        java.lang.String getSessionDescription()
                                       throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Returns a description of the stream using SDP. This method can only be called after configure().
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown when configure() wa not called.

      • isStreaming

        boolean isStreaming()
